intro: Etaballia guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan etaballia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody structure and large, palmately lobed leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Etaballia guianensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
